roles: Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations
supporting_quotes: 5th Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations Incumbent Assumed office 1 January 2017
is a Nigerian-British diplomat and politician who is serving as the 5th Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations
She is also Chair of United Nations Sustainable Development Group
Minister of Environment In office 11 November 2015 – 15 December 2016
Previously, she was Nigerian Minister of Environment from 2015 to 2016
Mohammed served as Federal Minister of the Environment in the First Cabinet of President Muhammadu Buhari from November 2015 to February 2017
She resigned from the Nigerian Federal Executive Council on 24 February 2017

roles: Nigeria's representative in AU Reform Steering Committee
supporting_quotes: During that time, she was Nigeria's representative in the African Union (AU) Reform Steering Committee, chaired by Paul Kagame
Between 1981 and 1991, Mohammed worked with Archcon Nigeria, an architectural design firm in association with Norman and Dawbarn United Kingdom
She founded Afri-Projects Consortium in 1991 and served as its Executive Director until 2001

roles: coordinator of Task Force on Gender and Education
supporting_quotes: From 2002 until 2005, Mohammed coordinated the Task Force on Gender and Education for the United Nations Millennium Project

roles: Senior Special Assistant to the President of Nigeria on Millennium Development Goals
supporting_quotes: Mohammed later acted as the Senior Special Assistant to the President of Nigeria on the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs)
In 2005, she was charged with the coordination of Nigeria's debt relief funds toward the achievement of the MDGs
Amina Mohammed later became the founder and CEO of the Center for Development Policy Solutions

roles: adjunct professor for Master's in Development Practice program
supporting_quotes: and as an adjunct professor for the Master's in Development Practice program at Columbia University

roles: Special Adviser to UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Post-2015 Development Planning
supporting_quotes: From 2012, Mohammed was a key player in the Post-2015 Development Agenda process, serving as the Special Adviser to UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Post-2015 development planning

roles: chair of Advisory Board of Global Monitoring Report on Education
supporting_quotes: She also chaired the Advisory Board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Global Monitoring Report on Education (GME)

roles: member of Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: she served on numerous international advisory boards and panels, including the UN Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda

roles: member of Independent Expert Advisory Group on the Data Revolution for Sustainable Development
supporting_quotes: and the Independent Expert Advisory Group on the Data Revolution for Sustainable Development
From 2014, she also served on the Secretary-General's Independent Expert Advisory Group on the Data Revolution for Sustainable Development
